text.section: On request of a court of another state, a court of this State may hold a hearing or enter an order described in subsection (a) of this section.
Travel and other necessary and reasonable expenses incurred under subsections (a) and (b) of this section may be assessed against the parties according to the law of this State.

section.section: A court of this State shall preserve the pleadings, orders, decrees, records of hearings, evaluations, and other pertinent records with respect to a child custody proceeding until the child attains 18 years of age.
On appropriate request by a court or law enforcement official of another state, the court shall forward a certified copy of those records.
